remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: meter

HTMLMeterElementMin.summary: The min property of the interface represents the minimum value of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's min attribute, or 0 if no min is defined.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementValue.summary: The value property of the interface represents the current value of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's value attribute. If no value is set, it is the value or 0, whichever is greater.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementValue.value: A number. Defaults to either or 0, whichever if greater, if not defined.

HTMLMeterElementOptimum.summary: The optimum property of the interface represents the optimum boundary of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's optimum attribute, or the midpoint between min and max values if not defined. The value of optimum is clamped by the min and max values.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementOptimum.value: A number. Defaults to the midpoint between and if not defined.

HTMLMeterElementLow.summary: The low property of the interface represents the low boundary of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's low attribute, or the value of min if not defined. The value of low is clamped by the min and max values.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementLow.value: A number that is not less than nor greater than .

HTMLMeterElementLabels.summary:
The HTMLMeterElement.labels read-only property returns a
of the {{HTMLElement("label")}} elements associated with the
meter element.
HTMLMeterElementLabels.value:
A containing the <label> elements associated
with the <meter> element.

HTMLMeterElementMax.summary: The max property of the interface represents the maximum value of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's max attribute, or the min value if no max is set, or 1 if neither the min or the max is defined.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementHigh.summary: The high property of the interface represents the high boundary of the {{htmlelement("meter")}} element as a floating-point number. It reflects the element's high attribute, or the value of max if not defined. The value of high is clamped by the low and max values.

remarks.para: This property can also be set directly, for example to set a default value based on some condition.

HTMLMeterElementHigh.value: A number that is not less than nor greater than .
